intro: Cynanchum lopezpalaciosii, commonly known as Lopezpalacios' dogbane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by follicles that contain seeds. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
